meanings.definition: A pointed end where two curves meet
meanings.sent1: The cusp of the mountain was sharp and dangerous.
meanings.sent2: She carefully traced the cusp of the heart-shaped leaf.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the cusp of the table, pretending to be the king of the castle.
meanings.sent4: At the cusp of dawn, the sky was painted in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The cusp of the wave crashed against the shore with a mighty roar.

meanings.definition: A point of transition between two different states or conditions
meanings.sent1: The cusp between childhood and adulthood can be challenging.
meanings.sent2: The company was at the cusp of success when they launched their new product.
meanings.sent3: Standing on the cusp of change, she felt a mix of excitement and nervousness.
meanings.sent4: The cusp of the storm brought strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set on the cusp of the horizon, the sky turned a beautiful shade of purple.
